vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.12; married to Eliphaz (H0464);
mother of: Amalek (H6002H)
§ Timna or Timnah = "restrained"
n pr m
1) a chief or duke of Esau and of Edom
n pr f
2) the concubine of Eliphaz, the son of Esau
3) daughter of Seir the Horite and sister of Lotan
vocabinfos._es_Definition: (a)   concubina de Elifaz, hijo de Esaú; (b)   hermana de Lotán, hijo de Seír; (c)   hijo de Elifaz, hijo de Esaú; (d)   jefe de Edom
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
亭納 这个字在希伯來文的意思是 "限制的"
陽性專有名詞
1) 從以掃所出的(以東人的)族長或領導者
陰性專有名詞
2) 以掃兒子以利法的妾 (創 36:12)
3) 何利人西珥的女兒, 羅坍的妹子(創 36:22)(代上 1:39)
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
亭纳 这个字在希伯来文的意思是 "限制的"
阳性专有名词
1) 从以扫所出的(以东人的)族长或领导者
阴性专有名词
2) 以扫儿子以利法的妾 (创 36:12)
3) 何利人西珥的女儿, 罗坍的妹子(创 36:22)(代上 1:39)

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.22;
daughter of: Seir (H8165B);
sister of: Lotan (H3877), Shobal (H7732), Zibeon (H6649H), Anah (H6034H), Dishon (H1787), Ezer (H0687) and Dishan (H1789)
§ Timna or Timnah = "restrained"
n pr m
1) a chief or duke of Esau and of Edom
n pr f
2) the concubine of Eliphaz, the son of Esau
3) daughter of Seir the Horite and sister of Lotan

A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.40
§ Timna or Timnah = "restrained"
n pr m
1) a chief or duke of Esau and of Edom
n pr f
2) the concubine of Eliphaz, the son of Esau
3) daughter of Seir the Horite and sister of Lotan
